definition: Lixia or Start of Summer, 7th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 5th-20th May
surname Li
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately
summer
the Xia or Hsia dynasty c. 2000 BC/Xia of the Sixteen Kingdoms (407-432)/surname Xia

sentences.english: Xiaosi took the mobile out of the pocket. It was Li Xia.
sentences.chinese: 小司从口袋里掏出手机，看到是立夏。

sentences.english: Today is the Beginning of Summer.
On the day of lixia, the Chinese have many other interesting folk customs.
sentences.chinese: 立夏这天，我国民间还有很多趣味习俗。

sentences.english: It means the beginning of summer.
sentences.chinese: 立夏意味着夏季的开始。

definition: Liqiu or Start of Autumn, 13th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 7th-22nd August

Guyu or Grain Rain, 6th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 20th April-4th May
Jingzhe or Insects Wake, 3rd of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 6th-20th March
Qiufen or Autumn Equinox, 16th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 23rd September-7th October
Mangzhong or Grain in Beard, 9th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 6th-20th June
Bailu or White Dew, 15th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 8th-22nd September
final month of summer (i.e. sixth month of lunar calendar)
Hanlu or Cold Dew, 17th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 8th-22nd October
